greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = 5*binomial(n,k) - 4  for 0 <= k <= n.
link: Muniru A Asiru, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: First few rows of the triangle:
maple: T := proc (n, k) if k <= n then 5*binomial(n, k)-4 else 0 end if end proc: for n from 0 to 10 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0 .. n) end do; # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 20 2007
program: (MAGMA) [5*Binomial(n, k) -4: k in [0..n], n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
(Sage) [[5*binomial(n, k) -4 for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 12 2020
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 13 2007
